member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.Internals.DefaultFocusHandler
member.summary: Default implementation of for the WinForms implementation

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Internals.DefaultFocusHandler.OnGotFocus(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.IBrowser)
member.summary: Called when the browser component has received focus.
member.param: the ChromiumWebBrowser control
the browser object
member.remarks: Try to avoid needing to override this logic in a subclass. The implementation in DefaultFocusHandler relies on very detailed behavior of how WinForms and Windows interact during window activation.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Internals.DefaultFocusHandler.OnSetFocus(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.IBrowser,CefSharp.CefFocusSource)
member.summary: Called when the browser component is requesting focus.
member.param: the ChromiumWebBrowser control
the browser object
Indicates where the focus request is originating from.
member.returns: Return false to allow the focus to be set or true to cancel setting the focus.

member.name: M:CefSharp.WinForms.Internals.DefaultFocusHandler.OnTakeFocus(CefSharp.IWebBrowser,CefSharp.IBrowser,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when the browser component is about to lose focus. For instance, if focus was on the last HTML element and the user pressed the TAB key.
member.param: the ChromiumWebBrowser control
the browser object
Will be true if the browser is giving focus to the next component and false if the browser is giving focus to the previous component.

member.name: T:CefSharp.WinForms.IWinFormsWebBrowser
member.summary: WinForms specific implementation, has events the implementation exposes.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.IWinFormsWebBrowser.TitleChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the browser title changed. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.IWinFormsWebBrowser.AddressChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the browser address changed. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.summary: Browser initialization settings

member.summary: The value for disposal, if it's 1 (one) then this instance is either disposed or in the process of getting disposed

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is disposed.
member.value: if this instance is disposed; otherwise, .

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsActivating
member.summary: Set to true while handing an activating WM_ACTIVATE message. MUST ONLY be cleared by DefaultFocusHandler.
member.value: true if this instance is activating; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.BrowserSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the browser settings.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.ActivateBrowserOnCreation
member.summary: Activates browser upon creation, the default value is false. Prior to version 73 the default behaviour was to activate browser on creation (Equivilent of setting this property to true). To restore this behaviour set this value to true immediately after you create the instance. https://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/cef/issues/1856/branch-2526-cef-activates-browser-window

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.RequestContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the request context.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsLoading
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the control is currently loading one or more web pages (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance is loading; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.TooltipText
member.summary: The text that will be displayed as a ToolTip

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.Address
member.summary: The address (URL) which the browser control is currently displaying. Will automatically be updated as the user navigates to another page (e.g. by clicking on a link).
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.FocusHandler
member.summary: The for this ChromiumWebBrowser.
member.remarks: If you need customized focus handling behavior for WinForms, the suggested best practice would be to inherit from DefaultFocusHandler and try to avoid needing to override the logic in OnGotFocus. The implementation in DefaultFocusHandler relies on very detailed behavior of how WinForms and Windows interact during window activation.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.DragHandler
member.summary: Implement and assign to handle events related to dragging.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.ResourceRequestHandlerFactory
member.summary: Implement and control the loading of resources

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.LoadError
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the resource load for a navigation fails or is canceled. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.FrameLoadStart
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser begins loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method may not be called for a particular frame if the load request for that frame fails. For notification of overall browser load status use OnLoadingStateChange instead. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.
member.remarks: Whilst this may seem like a logical place to execute js, it's called before the DOM has been loaded, implement as it's called when the underlying V8Context is created

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.FrameLoadEnd
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the browser is done loading a frame. Multiple frames may be loading at the same time. Sub-frames may start or continue loading after the main frame load has ended. This method will always be called for all frames irrespective of whether the request completes successfully. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.LoadingStateChanged
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the Loading state has changed. This event will be fired twice. Once when loading is initiated either programmatically or by user action, and once when loading is terminated due to completion, cancellation of failure. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.ConsoleMessage
member.summary: Event handler for receiving Javascript console messages being sent from web pages. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread. (The exception to this is when your running with settings.MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false, then they'll be the same thread).

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.StatusMessage
member.summary: Event handler for changes to the status message. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread. (The exception to this is when your running with settings.MultiThreadedMessageLoop = false, then they'll be the same thread).

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.AddressChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the browser address changed. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.TitleChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the browser title changed. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsBrowserInitializedChanged
member.summary: Event called after the underlying CEF browser instance has been created. It's important to note this event is fired on a CEF UI thread, which by default is not the same as your application UI thread. It is unwise to block on this thread for any length of time as your browser will become unresponsive and/or hang.. To access UI elements you'll need to Invoke/Dispatch onto the UI Thread.

member.name: E:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.JavascriptMessageReceived
member.summary: Event handler that will get called when the message that originates from CefSharp.PostMessage

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.CanGoForward
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control currently supports the GoForward action (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance can go forward; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.CanGoBack
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the state of the control current supports the GoBack action (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance can go back; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.IsBrowserInitialized
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the WebBrowser is initialized (true) or not (false).
member.value: true if this instance is browser initialized; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the WPF control, this property is implemented as a Dependency Property and fully supports data binding.

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.CanExecuteJavascriptInMainFrame
member.summary: A flag that indicates if you can execute javascript in the main frame. Flag is set to true in IRenderProcessMessageHandler.OnContextCreated. and false in IRenderProcessMessageHandler.OnContextReleased

member.name: P:CefSharp.WinForms.ChromiumWebBrowser.UseParentFormMessageInterceptor
member.summary: ParentFormMessageInterceptor hooks the Form handle and forwards the move/active messages to the browser, the default is true and should only be required when using set to true.
